level.heading: Insurance fraud in the second degree.
level.text: A person commits the offense of insurance fraud in the second degree if that person knowingly engages in conduct specified in § 22-3225.02 with the intent to defraud or to fraudulently obtain property of another and the value of the property which is sought to be obtained is $1,000 or more.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 16-801 and § 22-3225.04.

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 512(c) of Public Safety Legislation Sixty-Day Layover Emergency Amendment Act of 2010 (D.C. Act 18-693, January 18, 2011, 58 DCR 640).

For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 512(c) of Public Safety Legislation Sixty-Day Layover Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2011 (D.C. Act 19-45, April 20, 2011, 58 DCR 3701).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-273
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-273, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 22-3225.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-377
level.text: For history of Law 18-377, see notes under § 22-303.
